Note: In urban areas, fewer Gikuyu men are polygynous in the 21st century and they live in single-family homes
Quote: The marriages of the schooled group were 67% monogamous versus 75% polygynous for the unschooled.
Source: Davison, Jean. 1996. Voices from Mutira: Change in the Lives of Rural Gikuyo Women, 1910-1995. Boulder: Lynne Rienner Publishers. https://ehrafworldcultures.yale.edu/document?id=fl10-010.
